intro: Blakeanthus cordatus, commonly known as the heartleaf blakeanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, sunny environments such as grasslands and riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to gardens and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
